Name: Canopic Chest of Tutankhamun
Description: This alabaster canopic chest is considered to be one of the finest masterpieces of Tutankhamun's collection. The interior of the chest is divided into four compartments, each with a cylindrical hollow covered by a lid elegantly carved in the form of the king's head. The lid was fixed to the chest with cords knotted to gold rings and bore the official seal of the royal necropolis.
